definition: to piece together/to join together/to stake all/adventurous/at the risk of one's life/to spell
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: He recombined the talisman but was unable to release his master.
sentences.chinese: 他拼合了那件寶物但還是無法釋放他的主人。

sentences.english: The doctor knitted her broken bones together.
sentences.chinese: 醫生把她的斷骨拼合好了。

sentences.english: In your layer options, select Flatten Image.
sentences.chinese: 在層菜單裏選擇拼合圖像。

sentences.english: Putting together the regional picture is like a puzzle.
sentences.chinese: 把地區圖景拼合起來就像一個拼板遊戲。

sentences.english: He was trying to piece up those fragments.
sentences.chinese: 他在設法把那些碎片拼合起來。

sentences.english: The allocator can't coalesce free space into larger blocks.
sentences.chinese: 分配程序不能將空閒空間拼合爲更大的內存塊。

sentences.english: The doctor knitted the two broken bones in his arm.
sentences.chinese: 醫生把他臂上的兩塊碎骨拼合好了。

sentences.english: The PT subtype granitoids mark the collision of continental blocks.
sentences.chinese: 富鋁改造亞型花崗岩類是陸塊碰撞拼合的標誌。

definition: to put sth together from component parts
to pile up/to put layer upon layer/(Tw) (computing) stack
variant of 連綴|连缀[lian2 zhui4]
